Documentation Roadmap

This section contains a roadmap for the new user with pointers on what to read first.

If you are new to RTI Data Distribution Service, we recommend starting in the following order:

  • See the Getting Started Guide for installation instructions and a brief tutorial on compiling and running a basic Hello World application.

  • See the Tutorial for a more advanced tutorial that guides you through the process for developing a simple stock-price application. This Tutorial illustrates the mechanics of using RTI Data Distribution Service to build a distributed application with specific data delivery requirements, and demonstrates a number of RTI Data Distribution Service's features.

  • The User's Manual begins with an introduction to general concepts of publish-subscribe communication and a tour of using RTI Data Distribution Service. The User's Manual also includes details on the behavioral model of RTI Data Distribution Service and different approaches to common problems solved with RTI Data Distribution Service.

  • The documentation in the DDS API Reference provides an overview of API classes and modules for the DDS data-centric publish-subscribe (DCPS) package from a programmer's perspective. Start by reading the documentation on the main page.

  • After reading the high level module documentation, look at the Publication Example and Subscription Example for step-by-step examples of creating a publication and subscription. These are hyperlinked code snippets to the full API documentation, and provide a good place to begin learning the APIs.

  • Next, work through your own application using the example code files generated by rtiddsgen.

  • To integrate similar code into your own application and build system, you will likely need to refer to the Platform Notes.
